snippet: The prisoner, Murod Juraev, had been imprisoned since Sept. 18, 1994, and was sometimes called the world’s longest-serving political prisoner by rights groups.
abstract: Murod Juraev, Uzbekistan’s longest-serving political prisoner, is released from prison after Sec of State John Kerry discusses human rights abuses with Uzbek authorities.
lead_paragraph: The prisoner, Murod Juraev, had been imprisoned since Sept. 18, 1994, and was sometimes called the world’s longest-serving political prisoner by rights groups.

headline.main: Uzbekistan Releases Political Prisoner After 21 Years
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Uzbekistan: Political Prisoner Is Freed
